fig.show()

source.9a5a78db:
countries = list(df['Country'].unique())
max_infection_rates = []
for c in countries:
    MIR = df[df.Country == c].Confirmed.diff().max()
    max_infection_rates.append(MIR)
source.b2bf26b0:
df_MIR = pd.DataFrame()
df_MIR['Country'] = countries
df_MIR['Max Infection Rate'] = max_infection_rates
df_MIR.head()
source.ba18ae4f: px.bar(df_MIR, x='Country', y='Max Infection Rate', color='Country', title='Global Maximum Infection Rate', log_y=True).update_xaxes(categoryorder='total descending')
source.03a1edef:
fig = px.line(df_italy, x='Date', y='Infection Rate', title='Daily Infection Rate in Italy')
# 1st lockdown
fig.add_shape(
    dict(type='line', x0=italy_start1, y0=0, x1=italy_start1, y1=df_italy['Infection Rate'].max(), line= dict(color='red', width=2)))
fig.add_annotation(
    dict(x=italy_start1, y=df_italy['Infection Rate'].max(), text='Lockdown start date'))
fig.add_shape(
    dict(type='line', x0=italy_end1, y0=0, x1=italy_end1, y1=df_italy['Infection Rate'].max(), line= dict(color='red', width=2)))
fig.add_annotation(
    dict(x=italy_end1, y=0, text='a month later'))
# 2nd lockdown
fig.add_shape(
    dict(type='line', x0=italy_start2, y0=0, x1=italy_start2, y1=df_italy['Infection Rate'].max(), line= dict(color='red', width=2)))
fig.add_annotation(
    dict(x=italy_start2, y=df_italy['Infection Rate'].max(), text='Lockdown start date'))
fig.add_shape(
    dict(type='line', x0=italy_end2, y0=0, x1=italy_end2, y1=df_italy['Infection Rate'].max(), line= dict(color='red', width=2)))
fig.add_annotation(
    dict(x=italy_end2, y=0, text='a month later'))
# 3rd lockdown
fig.add_shape(
    dict(type='line', x0=italy_start3, y0=0, x1=italy_start3, y1=df_italy['Infection Rate'].max(), line= dict(color='red', width=2)))
fig.add_annotation(
    dict(x=italy_start3, y=df_italy['Infection Rate'].max(), text='Lockdown start date'))
fig.add_shape(
    dict(type='line', x0=italy_end3, y0=0, x1=italy_end3, y1=df_italy['Infection Rate'].max(), line= dict(color='red', width=2)))
fig.add_annotation(
    dict(x=italy_end3, y=0, text='a month later'))

## Project Goals
1. To see the global spread of COVID19 confirmed cases and deaths
1. To see the effect of national lockdowns of Italy against COVID19 spread
1. Comparing the effects of national lockdowns of Italy with France

source.7e146221: ##### COVID19 pandemic lockdowns in Italy On 9 March 2020, the government of Italy under Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte imposed a national quarantine, restricting the movement of the population except for necessity, work, and health circumstances, in response to the growing pandemic of COVID-19 in the country. source. Further national lockdowns from 24 December 2020 to 6 January 2021, and from 15 March 2021 to 30 April 2021. [source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_lockdowns).

source.71f7db4c:
##### Drop anomalies where infection rate is negative
This is likely because France adjusted their confirmed cases in removing duplicate cases, especially on 4 April 2020, 4 November 2020 and 20 May 2021.

source.de551433:
## COVID19 pandemic lockdowns in France 
France also had three lockdowns. From 17 March 2020 to 11 May 2020, from 30 October 2020 to 15 December 2020, and from 4 April 2021 to 3 May 2021. We will take a look at these periods in comparsion to Italy. [source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_lockdowns).
